OOC: Jotunn isn't in a state of mind where he is thinking logically.
Right =
at that moment, he doesn't give much knowing if his troop can or
can't reac=
h the Minions.

BIC: 

The missiles hit Jotunn and sent him skidding a long=
 distance away.
His frustration was now as palpable as the various shrapnel=
s and tears
in his armor.

Jotunn: Urgh... Beast... Mode...

He reverted to=
 his massive beast mode, He would normally have been a
terror, but was now =
terrible to look at.

Dragon Trooper: Commander, we could not hurt them. Th=
ey're too far
gone, probably headed away... We, uh... We lost this battle.
=

Jotunn gave an angry and pained groan. He stumbled as he advanced
towards =
the trooper.

Jotunn: You don't have the guts... Coward! Just admit it! All=
 of you!
This battle was nothing! We have lost this world! Now that they ha=
ve
the Matrix, we are Unicron's slagging apetizer!

He fell flat on his che=
st, sparks sizzling in the missile wounds.

Jotunn: Get me out of here... W=
e regroup and rebuild. Grimlock... I
have a special assignment for you...

=

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>=

> 
> --- Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:
> 
> > Jotunn: No... All this... It=
's not right! They're leaving! They have
> > what they came here to get! Sl=
ag you, Rodimus! Your honor has doomed
> > us all! DRAGON CORPS! CHANGE OF =
ORDERS! ENGAGE AND DESTROY ALL
> > MINIONS
> > RIGHT AWAY! THIS IS A PRIORI=
TY OBJECTIVE! WE STOP THEM FROM LEAVING,

NG!

ind

> OOC: I am honestly unsure how many of the Dragon Corp there ar=
e, nor
> thier speed capabilities. Also I can only assume that since no one=

> Cyc=
lonus, Scourge, Rodimus, Remus, and the sweeps was still at Atlantis
> duri=
ng the battle??? Which would mean that all would have some distance
> to ma=
ke up before they would catch up with Cyc. 
> 
> Also I am having to assume=
 that Cyclonus and crew are being shot at

nge, but they are moving fast. Cyc is
> not going to hang around. So please=
 consider my responses an amending

> BIC:
> 
> In =
the air, the fading from view but not quite gone Cyclonus is moving
> swift=
ly through the air. His body is digesting the new power it has
> recieved a=
nd is enjoying it. Power flows through his circuits as his
> own systems me=
rge with the now corrupted power of the matrix. His form
> seems to radiate=
 a new power, his fusion powered engines thrusting him
> foward at amazing =
speeds. He knew he would be able to hold this new
> power, his instructions=
 from Unicron had said as much, but the sheer
> power was almost intoxicati=
ng. Internally he smiled.
> 
> It was then that bullets from a gatling gun =
caught up with him, lightly
> scored his armor and then fell behind as the =
Cyclonus whipped foward!
> It was not that the guns lacked power, but simpl=
y the speed that these
> ships were flying and the distance they were away,=
 by the time the
> bullets caught up they were as pebbles striking titanium=
 shields. 
> 
> Howerever Cyclonus did have a response as twin missiles err=
upted from
> beneath his wings. For a moment the missiles seemed to hover 
=
> as they changed direction orienting on thier target. Then they burst
> in=
to explosive movement, glowing with encapselated power. Rather then
> missi=
les with flame behind them as Cyclonus' missiles looked before,
> they were=
 now like twin suns as they fairly irradiated power and
> destruction as th=
ey moved toward the source of the bullets: 
> 
> As the missiles streak pas=
sed, the sweeps fall in behind Cyclonus and
> Scourge, forming a protective=
 shield as they pick up speed.
> 
> For the moment Remus is ignored as the =
Unicronians moved foward,
> picking up speed!
>
